definition: folk art consisting of storytelling to music
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book/letter/document/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]/to write

sentences.english: I know radio began by restoring the ancient art of storyteller .
sentences.chinese: 我知道，廣播的開始是藉助於說書人這種古老藝術。

sentences.english: Second, I want to read some books I like, such as the fiction books.
sentences.chinese: 其次，我想讀一些我喜歡的書籍，比如小說書。

sentences.english: AMUSE】The storyteller's jokes amused the children.
sentences.chinese: 說書人的笑話逗樂了孩子。

sentences.english: "Red" pious, boasts many followers of the "nine" music.
sentences.chinese: “說書紅”弟子很多，號稱有“高門九英”之說。

sentences.english: The story breathes with the teller's breath.
sentences.chinese: 故事與說書人一同呼吸。

sentences.english: What are you, like a clich movie bitch?
sentences.chinese: 你覺得自己是誰，一個說書的婊子？

sentences.english: In their time, they were better known as academics that storytellers .
sentences.chinese: 在他們年代，他們是以語言學者聞名而非說書人。

sentences.english: I like reading Novel books and Science book.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡閱讀小說書和科學書。

sentences.english: This is my own disappointment, not suitable for storytelling.
sentences.chinese: 這是我對自己的失望，不宜用來說書。

sentences.english: It developed into an independent art form in the early years of the Qing Dynasty (late 17thcentury).
sentences.chinese: 評書作爲一種獨立的說書品種，大約形成於清代初期。

sentences.english: Which of these novels do you like best?
sentences.chinese: 這些小說書你最喜歡哪一本？

sentences.english: Story-telling is a folk art much loved by the Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 說書是中國人喜聞樂見的民間藝術。

sentences.english: But first we want to tell you a story about a group of storytellers .
sentences.chinese: 首先我們想告訴你們一個關於一羣說書人的故事。

sentences.english: Books and recordings, they assumed, were destined to take the place of storytellers.
sentences.chinese: 書和唱片，他們推測，註定會取代說書人。

sentences.english: A storyteller once came to the marketplace, and I sneaked off to listen to him.
sentences.chinese: 有一段時間，集市上來了一個說書人。

definition: lit. to quote the classics/to quote chapter and verse (idiom)
calligraphy society/village school (old)/literary society (old)
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
lit. an easy drive on a familiar path (idiom); fig. experience makes progress easy/a task that is so familiar one can do it with one's hand tied behind one's back
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to attend an opera/to see an opera
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
social connections/stratagem/method/approach/movement (martial arts)/(sb's) background story
(of an uneducated person) to mingle with the cognoscenti/to pose as a culture lover/to be a culture snob/having pretensions to culture
writings in the vernacular
unheard of/an extremely rare and unprecedented event
tied up in a bundle on a high shelf/to put sth on the back burner/no longer a high priority
to smash
united front (abbr. for 統一戰線|统一战线[tong3 yi1 zhan4 xian4])
